text: welcome to let's talk a premie Learning
Center for English communication skills
making you speak fluent English with
neutral accent adjectives a word used to
describe a noun is called an adjective
or we can also say objective is a word
used to add meaning to the noun for
example this is a beautiful flower we
all know flower is a noun beautiful is
describing the quality of the flower
hence it is an adjective all words
denoting numbers shapes quantity and
quality are adjectives the hand has five
fingers five is a number and hence is an
adjective the baby has a round face the
shape of the baby's face is described as
round
hence round is an adjective I ate some
rice the word some denotes the quantity
of rice I ate thus some is an adjective
call center agents are hardworking here
the quality of the call center agents is
described as hardworking hence
hardworking is an adjective the papers
length is 12 centimeters here the paper
size is described as 12 centimeters and
ejected many adjectives are formed from
nouns
for example boy boy fool foolish care
careful play playful hope hopeful shame
shameless gold golden man man Li Qing
Qing Li dirt dirty since senseless storm
stormy laugh laughable gift gifted some
adjectives are formed from verbs for
example tile tireless talk talkative
cease ceaseless move movable some
adjectives are formed from other
adjectives for example tragic tragical
whole wholesome three threefold black
blackish white whitish sick sickly
this is a demonstration video for
English grammar level 1 for complete
course visit our website at let's talk
co dot in
you
